result.execSummary:
The defendant Latasha Danae Houston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 2 and any other sentence, with credit for 9 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
* Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the period of probation, cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or entry of
 a civil judgment.
* Pay all supervision fees.
* Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
* Restitution is set at $0.
* Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.
* No contact with any Kohl's or Macy's stores.  Warning given.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
 and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
 use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
 treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latasha Danae Houston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 2 and any other sentence, with credit for 9 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with any Kohl's or Macy's stores.  Warning given.
* Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the period of probation, cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or entry of a civil judgment.
* Pay all supervision fees.
* Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.
* Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
* Restitution is set at $0.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Victim Impact Statement, received and filed.

Defendant Latasha Danae Houston in court with law student Solomon Gatton under supervision of attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court via telephone.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Scheduling conference held off the record.  Defendant's child is ill and cannot attend child care.  Defense requests adjournment.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Latasha Danae Houston in court with attorney Colin McGinn for attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Latasha Danae Houston in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Newly appointed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Stores in Milwaukee County

Defendant Latasha Danae Houston in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Latasha Danae Houston in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Latasha Danae Houston not in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/8/15 @ 1:30 pm
